definition: to set aside for/to keep as
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: He sets aside a sum of money every year for his old age.
sentences.chinese: 他每年省出一筆錢，留作他晚年用。

sentences.english: Parklands , which separate the city and the suburbs, are preserved in perpetuity for the use of the people.
sentences.chinese: 市區和郊區之間的公園區永遠留作供人們使用的場所。

sentences.english: Some people reserve them for a fancy bookplate .
sentences.chinese: 有些人將它們留作貼花哨的藏書票用。

sentences.english: Some go back and delete the Twitters the next day, others just leave it on the record.
sentences.chinese: 有些人隔天回去刪文，有些人則讓它留作紀錄。

sentences.english: He boiled them clean to save as a keepsake.
sentences.chinese: 他將這些鹿角煮乾淨之後並把它們留作了紀念品。

sentences.english: Mary saved up pieces of cloth to make a quilt.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗存了幾塊布留作棉被用。

definition: fee paid to an author for a piece of writing
to keep/to preserve/extant/to remain (from the past)
to use for the purpose of/to serve as

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
a possible period of want or need
